definition: vassal state
all/various
surname Zhu
marquis, second of the five orders of ancient Chinese nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/nobleman or high official
surname Hou
country/nation/state/national/CL:個|个[ge4]
surname Guo

sentences.english: Before that, China was a confederation of states, called "the middle kingdoms".
sentences.chinese: 統一之前，中國是諸侯國的邦聯，叫做“中央王國”。

sentences.english: Small kingdom built huge walls aiming at protecting their territories.
sentences.chinese: 諸侯國修起城牆，藉以保護他們的領土。

sentences.english: So the territory of Shang should include these states into it.
sentences.chinese: 商代國家疆域應包括這些諸侯國在內。

sentences.english: Diplomacy had much function in each development process of various states.
sentences.chinese: 邦交在各諸侯國的發展過程中起着非常重要的作用。

sentences.english: Ducal states at that time built walls to defend their own territories.
sentences.chinese: 當時的各個諸侯國爲了保護自己的領地而修建城牆。

sentences.english: Ying State was a feudal princedom in Central Plains in the Western Zhou period.
sentences.chinese: 應國是我國西周時期中原地區的一個小諸侯國。

sentences.english: From a vassal small to independent fiefdoms, qin dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 從一個附庸小國到獨立的諸侯國，秦。

definition: Lü Buwei (?291-235 BC), merchant and politician of the State of Qin 秦國|秦国[Qin2 guo2], subsequent Qin Dynasty 秦代[Qin2 dai4] Chancellor, allegedly the father of Ying Zheng 嬴政[Ying2 Zheng4], who subsequently became the first emperor Qin Shihuang 秦始皇[Qin2 Shi3 huang2]
Duke Huan of Qi (reigned 685-643 BC), one of the Five Hegemons 春秋五霸

Yan, a vassal state of Zhou in modern Hebei and Liaoning/north Hebei/the four Yan kingdoms of the Sixteen Kingdoms, namely: Former Yan 前燕 (337-370), Later Yan 後燕|后燕 (384-409), Southern Yan 南燕 (398-410), Northern Yan 北燕 (409-436)
the state of Qin, one of the seven states of the Warring States Period (475-220 BC)
to engage in wars of aggression at will (idiom)/militaristic/bellicose
centralized power (history), e.g. under an Emperor or party
Duke Wen of Jin (697-628 BC, reigned 636-628 BC), one of the Five Hegemons 春秋五霸
slavery
the state of Chu, one of the most important of the small states contending for power in China between 770 and 223 BC, located around present-day Hubei
skilled manipulator/tactician/strategist/advisor/counsellor
posthumous name of the first Han emperor Liu Bang 劉邦|刘邦 (256 or 247-195 BC), reigned 202-195 BC
Emperor Wen of Han (202-157 BC), fourth Han emperor, personal name Liu Heng 劉恆|刘恒[Liu2 Heng2], reigned 180-157 BC
Liu Yuan, warlord at the end of the Western Jin dynasty 西晋, founder of Cheng Han of the Sixteen Kingdoms 成漢|成汉 (304-347)
centralized state power
Zhao, one of the seven states during the Warring States Period of Chinese history (475-220 BC)
Emperor Xian of Han (181-234), the final Han emperor, set up by Dong Zhuo 董卓, reigned 189-220, forced to abdicate 220 by Cao Pi 曹丕
